intro: Oxydectes cneorifolia, commonly known as the common rockrose, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, often yellow or white flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It is often used in landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value. Oxydectes cneorifolia is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
